name: Apex
description: Salesforce's proprietary, strongly typed, object-oriented programming language used to execute server-side logic.
example: Apex triggers run automatically before or after database events like insert or update.
python: print('Apex runs on the Salesforce server, not the client!')

name: SOQL
description: Salesforce Object Query Language – a SQL-like language to query data from Salesforce objects.
example: SELECT Id, Name, AnnualRevenue FROM Account WHERE Industry = 'Technology' AND AnnualRevenue > 1000000
python:
soql = 'SELECT Id, Name FROM Account WHERE Industry = "Technology"'
print(f'SOQL Query: {soql}')

name: SOSL
description: Salesforce Object Search Language – used for text-based search across multiple objects.
example: FIND {cloud} RETURNING Account(Name), Contact(FirstName, LastName)
python:
sosl = 'FIND {cloud} RETURNING Account(Name), Contact(Name)'
print(f'SOSL Search: {sosl}')

name: Governor Limits
description: Runtime limits enforced by Salesforce to ensure fair resource usage in a multi-tenant environment.
example: Maximum 150 DML statements per transaction; 100 SOQL queries per transaction.

name: Trigger
description: Apex code that executes automatically before or after DML events (insert, update, delete, etc.).
example: trigger UpdateAccount on Account (before update) { ... }
python: print('Trigger fires on database events — like a database hook!')

name: Lightning Web Components (LWC)
description: Modern framework for building fast, standards-based UI components using JavaScript and Web Components.
example: <c-my-component></c-my-component> in a Lightning page.
python: print('LWC runs in the browser using modern JS — no Aura overhead!')

name: Aura Components
description: Legacy Salesforce UI framework (now in maintenance mode) using a component-event model.
example: <aura:application> with <c:childComponent/>
python: print('Aura is being replaced by LWC for new development.')

name: Flow
description: Declarative automation tool to build business processes using a drag-and-drop interface.
example: Screen Flow to collect user input and update records.

name: Process Builder
description: Legacy declarative automation tool (retiring); replaced by Flow.
example: Auto-update Opportunity stage when a field changes.

name: Metadata API
description: REST/SOAP API to manage Salesforce org configuration (custom objects, fields, layouts, etc.).
example: Used by SFDX: sfdx force:mdapi:retrieve

name: Tooling API
description: API for developing IDE tools and interacting with developer metadata (Apex classes, triggers, etc.).
example: Query ApexClass or run Apex tests programmatically.
python: print('Tooling API helps build VS Code extensions for Salesforce!')

name: Salesforce CLI (SFDX)
description: Command-line interface for developing, testing, and deploying Salesforce apps.
example: sfdx force:org:create - sfdx force:source:push

name: Scratch Org
description: Temporary, source-driven Salesforce org for development and testing.
example: Created via definition file: scratch-def.json

name: Sandbox
description: Copy of a production org used for development, testing, or training.
example: Full, Partial, Developer, Developer Pro sandboxes.

name: Change Set
description: Point-and-click tool to deploy metadata between connected Salesforce orgs.
example: Outbound from sandbox → Inbound to production.

name: AppExchange
description: Salesforce marketplace for pre-built apps, components, and consulting services.
example: Install DocuSign or Slack integration from AppExchange.

name: Custom Object
description: User-defined database table in Salesforce to store unique business data.
example: __c suffix: Property__c, Inspection__c

name: Custom Field
description: User-defined field on a standard or custom object.
example: Commission_Rate__c (Percent(5,2)) on Opportunity.

name: Validation Rule
description: Declarative rule to enforce data quality and prevent invalid data entry.
example: ISPICKVAL(StageName, 'Closed Lost') && ISBLANK(Reason_Lost__c)
python:
is_invalid = True  # simulate validation failure
print('Validation Failed!' if is_invalid else 'Valid Entry')

name: Workflow Rule
description: Legacy automation to send emails, update fields, or create tasks (deprecated).
example: Send email when Opportunity is 'Closed Won'.

name: Record Type
description: Allows different page layouts, picklist values, and business processes per profile.
example: Recruitment vs. Sales process on the same Opportunity object.

name: Page Layout
description: Defines the organization of fields, buttons, and related lists on a record detail page.
example: Different layouts per profile or record type.
python: print('Page Layout controls what users see on a record.')

name: Profile
description: Controls user permissions at the object and field level, and access to apps and tabs.
example: System Administrator vs. Sales User profiles.

name: Permission Set
description: Collection of permissions and settings to extend user access without changing profiles.
example: Grant 'Export Reports' to specific users only.

name: Sharing Rules
description: Extend record access beyond organization-wide defaults (OWD).
example: Share Accounts with role hierarchy or specific groups.
python: print('Sharing Rules open up access beyond OWD.')

name: Organization-Wide Defaults (OWD)
description: Baseline record access level for each object (Private, Public Read, Public Read/Write).
example: Account OWD = Private → users only see their own accounts by default.

name: Data Loader
description: Client application for bulk import, export, update, or delete of Salesforce data.
example: Export 50,000 leads or upsert records via CSV.
python: print('Data Loader = Bulk data operations via CSV!')

name: REST API
description: Lightweight API for integrating Salesforce with external systems using HTTP and JSON.
example: GET /services/data/vXX.X/query/?q=SELECT+Name+FROM+Account

name: Bulk API
description: Asynchronous API for processing large volumes of data (millions of records).
example: Load 5 million records in batches.

name: Connected App
description: Framework to allow external applications to integrate with Salesforce via APIs.
example: OAuth-enabled app for SSO or data sync.

name: Einstein
description: Salesforce's AI platform for predictions, recommendations, and automation.
example: Einstein Opportunity Scoring, Einstein Bots.
